author: kevin
msg: Wow, that required a lot of changes!!
svn update --nonrecursive now works.
* svn_wc.h: svn_wc_crawl_revisions,svn_wc_get_update_editor,
svn_wc_get_checkout_editor - added recurse arg.
* svn_client.h: svn_client_update,svn_client_checkout - added recurse arg.
* svn_repos.h: svn_repos_begin_report,svn_repos_dir_delta - added recurse
arg.
* svn_ra.h: do_update,do_checkout - added recurse arg.
* libsvn_wc/wc.h: svn_wc__ensure_uniform_revision - added recurse arg.
* libsvn_wc/adm_crawler.c: report_revisions - take new recurse arg, only
report_revisions on files if recurse is TRUE.  Pass recurse (which must
be true by this point) to self.
* libsvn_wc/adm_crawler.c: svn_wc_crawl_revisions - take new recurse arg,
pass it on to report_revisions.
* libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c: svn_wc__ensure_uniform_revision - take new recurse
arg, only call self if recurse is true.
* libsvn_wc/get_editor.c: edit_baton - new member - recurse.
* libsvn_wc/get_editor.c: close_edit - pass eb->recurse to
ensure_uniform_revision.
* libsvn_wc/get_editor.c: make_editor - take new recurse arg, set the
edit_baton's recurse member accordingly.
* libsvn_wc/get_editor.c: svn_wc_get_update_editor,
svn_wc_get_checkout_editor - take new recurse arg, pass to make_editor.
* libsvn_ra_local/ra_plugin.c: do_update,do_status - take new recurse arg,
pass to svn_repos_begin_report.
* libsvn_client/checkout.c: svn_client_checkout - take new recurse arg,
pass to svn_wc_get_checkout_editor.
* libsvn_client/apply_edits.c: apply_delta - take new recurse arg, pass to
svn_wc_get_update_editor or svn_wc_get_checkout_editor as appropriate.
* libsvn_client/apply_edits.c: do_edits - take new recurse arg, pass to
apply_delta.
* libsvn_client/apply_edits.c: svn_client__checkout_internal,
svn_client__update_internal - take new recurse arg, pass to do_edits.
* libsvn_client/update.c: svn_client_update - take new recurse arg, pass
to svn_wc_get_update_editor, ra_lib->do_update, and svn_wc_crawl_revisions.
* libsvn_client/client.h: svn_client__checkout_internal,
svn_client__update_internal - take new recurse arg.
* libsvn_client/status.c: svn_client_status - pass descend arg down to
ra_lib->do_status and svn_wc_crawl_revisions, now that they can be
non-recursive.
* svnlook/main.c: generate_delta_tree - pass TRUE for new recurse arg to
svn_repos_dir_delta.
* mod_dav_svn/merge.c: dav_svn__merge_response - pass TRUE for new recurse
arg to svn_repos_dir_delta.
* mod_dav_svn/update.c: dav_svn__update_report - determine if the update is
recursive via new recursive element in the update report.  If it exists and
equals "no" we are non-recursive, otherwise we assume recursive.  Pass
recursiveness into svn_repos_begin_report.
* clients/cmdline/checkout-cmd.c:svn_cl__checkout - pass recursive option
status to svn_client_checkout as recurse arg.
* clients/cmdline/update-cmd.c:svn_cl__update - pass recursive option
status to svn_client_update as recurse arg.
* tests/libsvn_wc/checkout-test.c: apply_delta - pass TRUE for recurse
option to svn_wc_get_checkout_editor.
* tests/libsvn_repos/repos-test.c - pass TRUE for recurse option to
svn_repos_dir_delta.
* libsvn_repos/reporter.c: svn_repos_report_baton_t - new member "recurse".
* libsvn_repos/reporter.c: svn_repos_finish_report - pass new
rbaton->recurse to svn_repos_dir_delta.
* libsvn_repos/reporter.c: svn_repos_begin_report - take new recurse arg,
and stash it in the baton.
* libsvn_repos/delta.c: context - new member recurse.
* libsvn_repos/delta.c: svn_repos_dir_delta - take new recurse arg, and
store it in the context objects.
* libsvn_repos/delta.c: delta_dirs - the meat of this commit.  Only perform
operations on dirs if they c->recurse is true.
* libsvn_ra_dav/ra_dav.h: svn_ra_dav__do_update,svn_ra_dav__do_status - take
new recurse arg.
* libsvn_ra_dav/fetch.c: make_reporter - take new recurse arg.  If it is
FALSE, write a <S:recursive>no</S:recursive> to the update report.
* libsvn_ra_dav/fetch.c: svn_ra_dav__do_update, svn_ra_dav__do_status - Take
new recurse arg, and pass it to make reporter.
You're still reading, I'm shocked:)

author: kfogel
msg: This resolves part of issue #530, namely, commit test 10, but does not
close the issue, as commit test 11 remains.
* repos.c (dav_svn_remove_resource): Don't error on deletion of a
non-existent entry, because that's allowed under the merge rules.
* svn_fs.h (svn_fs_delete_tree): Document exact circumstances under
which SVN_ERR_FS_NO_SUCH_ENTRY is returned.
* tree.c (txn_body_delete): Same.
* dag.h (svn_fs__dag_delete, svn_fs__dag_delete_tree): Same.
* dag.c (delete_entry): Same, plus fix typo in comment.

author: sussman
msg: Fix bug #534, and possibly the looooong-standing bug #487.
Tracked down by sussman, fixed by kfogel!
* merge.c (handle_resource): This is the magic fix.  This function was
forgetting to look for the special case where the href and base_href
are *equal* to each other.  In such a case, the "relative" path is
just an empty string.  This explains a lot.
Cleanup:  make 'relative' into a const char *.  Remove gstein's
complaint.  :-)
(bump_resource):  take a const char * path, build svn_stringbuf_t's.

author: dws
msg: Changed subversion.spec to get rid of unnecessary /usr/bin/neon-config and /usr/lib/APRVARS files.  Also made apr and neon variables to make future changes more easily.

author: sussman
msg: Analysis of existing and future commit systems.  (gstein want to comment?) :-)
